alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:01PM EDT until July 15 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN MERCER, CENTRAL MIDDLESEX, SOUTHERN SOMERSET, SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON, AND EAST CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTIES... At 701 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in central Middlesex County. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Princeton, Pennington, New Hope, Hopewell, and Rocky Hill. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 124 and 132. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
